Class Customer

java.lang.Object
Customer
public class Customer extends Object
Represents a bank customer with personal and contact details.

Each customer has a unique internal ID (e.g., C001) generated by the system and a unique national identification number (CNP). Instances are used to open accounts and manage banking relationships.

Some properties may be used by authentication/user management (e.g., in User), while others define the customer's identity and address. author Ilinca Rusescu

  • Constructor Details

    • Customer

      public Customer(String firstName, String lastName, int age, String gender, String email, String phoneNumber, String cnp, String addressLine1, String addressLine2, String city, String postalCode, String country)
      Contruscts a new Customer with personal, contact, and address details.
      Parameters:
      firstName - customer's first name
      lastName - customer's last name
      age - customer's age (must be >= 18)
      gender - customer's gender
      email - customer's email address
      phoneNumber - customer's phone number (10 digits)
      cnp - national identification number (13 digits, unique)
      addressLine1 - main address line (required)
      addressLine2 - optional address line (can be empty)
      city - customer's city
      postalCode - postal code (numeric, 4â€“6 digits)
      country - 2-letter ISO country code (e.g., "RO")
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any validation fails
